## Vocabulary Introduction: Family Members

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- மகற்கு (magarku) - to the son
- பெண் (pen) - woman/girl
- தந்த (thantha) - given
- தந்தை (thanthai) - father
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
- பார்ப்பான் (paarpaan) - Brahmin/priest
- மடவார்கண் (madavaarkan) - in the eyes of the innocent
- தவ்வையைக் (thavvaiyaik) - younger paternal aunt (accusative)
:::
:::

## Vocabulary Introduction: Relationships and Body Parts

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- உடையான்கண்ணே (udaiyaankanae) - in the eyes of the possessor
- விருந்தோம்பல் (virunthombal) - hospitality
- குலன் (kulan) - family/lineage
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
- வாயினர் (vaayinar) - those with mouths
- கண்ணோடு (kannodu) - with the eye
- மார்பு (maarbu) - chest
:::
:::

## Vocabulary Introduction: Pronouns and Others

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- பிறர் (pirar) - others
- அவனை (avanai) - him (accusative)
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
- அல்லார் (allaar) - those who are not
:::
:::

## Activity 1: Family Tree Creation

1. Introduce a template family tree with Tamil labels
2. Students create their own family trees using Tamil words
3. Present family trees to the class, practicing pronunciation

::: {.notes}
Instructor: Prepare a template family tree beforehand. Encourage students to add additional relationships they know in Tamil. Help with pronunciation and usage of case markers like -க்கு (ku) in மகற்கு.
:::

## Activity 2: Relationship Dialogue Practice

Create and practice dialogues using the new vocabulary:

1. Introducing family members
2. Describing relationships
3. Practicing hospitality scenarios

Example:
A: உங்கள் தந்தை எங்கே? (Where is your father?)
B: என் தந்தை வீட்டில் இருக்கிறார். அவர் விருந்தோம்பல் செய்கிறார். (My father is at home. He is practicing hospitality.)

::: {.notes}
Instructor: Prepare dialogue templates. Encourage students to modify and expand on them. Focus on proper use of pronouns and relationship terms.
:::

## Activity 3: Cultural Context Discussion

Discuss the cultural significance of:

1. விருந்தோம்பல் (hospitality) in Tamil culture
2. குலன் (family/lineage) and its importance
3. The role of பார்ப்பான் (Brahmin/priest) in society
4. The concept of கண்ணோடு (with the eye) in Tamil literature

::: {.notes}
Instructor: Prepare brief cultural notes on each topic. Encourage students to share their own cultural perspectives and compare with Tamil culture.
:::

## Practice Time!

In pairs, create a short story or dialogue incorporating at least 8 words from today's lesson, focusing on family relationships and cultural aspects.

Example:
தந்தை மகற்கு கூறினார், "நம் குலன் விருந்தோம்பல் செய்வது முக்கியம். பிறர் உதவி செய்." 
(The father said to the son, "It's important for our family to practice hospitality. Help others.")

## Recap

We learned:  
1. Vocabulary for family members and relationships  
2. Words related to body parts and social interactions  
3. Cultural context of family and hospitality in Tamil society  
4. How to use these words in dialogues and stories  

## Homework

1. Write a paragraph describing your family using the new vocabulary  
2. Create a dialogue between family members planning a விருந்தோம்பல் (hospitality) event  
3. Research and write a short note on the importance of குலன் (family/lineage) in Tamil culture
